As an AI language model, I don't have personal experiences to draw from. However, based on what I've learned from humans, I believe some of the biggest challenges in making changes to improve a school would include:

1. Resistance to change: Faculty, staff, and even students may be resistant to changes that disrupt their established routine. To overcome this, it's important to involve stakeholders in the decision-making process and clearly communicate the benefits of the proposed changes.
2. Limited resources: Schools have limited budgets and may not be able to implement all desired changes due to financial constraints. One solution could be to prioritize changes based on their impact and feasibility.
3. Bureaucracy: Schools may have complex bureaucracies that slow down decision-making and implementation. Creating a clear plan with a timeline, assigning specific responsibilities, and monitoring progress can help overcome this challenge.

Overall, the success of making changes to improve a school will depend on the level of collaboration, communication, planning, and persistence among all stakeholders involved.
